question.body: A portion of the pia mater, called the filum terminale, extends from the conus medullaris to the region of the sacrum and coccyx. This extension of the meninges supports what part of the central nervous system?

multiple_choice.choice: the spinal cord gray matter in the lumbar region
the spinal cord white matter in the lumbar and sacral regions
the spinal nerve roots and trunks in the vertebral foramen
the lumbar spinal nerves passing through the intervertebral foramen
the spinal nerve roots at the lumbar enlargement

response.feedback: Incorrect. This would only be found superior to the conus medullaris because the spinal cord itself ends at L1 and is deep to the spinal cord white matter.
Incorrect. This would only be found superior to the conus medullaris because the spinal cord itself ends at L1.
Correct. This supports the cauda equinus inferior to the conus medullaris within the vertebral column.
Incorrect. The pia mater is contained within the vertebral foramen of vertebrae, not peripherally with through intervertebral foramen between vertebrae.
Incorrect. The lumbar enlargement is found at the level of the inferior thoracic vertebrae, still superior to the conus medullaris.

part.hint: The conus medullaris is the terminus of the spinal cord near vertebrae L1.
